meanings.definition: Hollies: plural noun, a type of evergreen shrub or tree with shiny, prickly leaves and red berries.
meanings.sent1: The hollies in the garden looked beautiful with their shiny leaves and red berries.
meanings.sent2: During winter, the hollies add a festive touch to the landscape with their bright berries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel played hide-and-seek among the hollies, trying to steal the berries.
meanings.sent4: The hollies stood proudly in the yard, like guardians with their prickly leaves and vibrant berries.
meanings.sent5: Children love to make wreaths with hollies during the holiday season.

meanings.definition: Hollies: verb, the act of decorating with holly branches during the holiday season.
meanings.sent1: We will hollies the house with holly branches to celebrate Christmas.
meanings.sent2: Every year, families hollies their homes with holly branches for a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The elves worked tirelessly, holliesing the entire North Pole with holly branches.
meanings.sent4: She holliesed the room with holly branches, turning it into a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The town square was holliesed with holly branches, creating a magical scene for all to enjoy.
